metadata.synopsis: Before the point of no return when about to fight the brain, the player encounters Voss. If Orpheus is alive, he says he will help the player in combat. if Orpheus is dead, what happens depends on whether he is an illithid or not,
metadata.how_to_trigger: Debug book-> Set Quest Flags and Options-> Act3 (END)-> High Hall-> Force Voss EncounterDebug book-> Go to region-> Act 3-> End Game-> High Hall Start-> Walk towards the stairs

31.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
31.context: CinematicNodeContext: Waiting in hostile pose. General hostile stance and no weapon is fine.NodeContext: CANE-cha GAYK, a bit guttural. (Disgusting mind flayer.)

161.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
161.text: Vile thing. My prince is dead, his death scream heard across the entire Astral Plane. Our future broken.

152.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
152.text: You have stolen everything from me, illithid. And you will suffer for it!

69.speaker: Player
69.text: It's me, [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53]. You must believe me.

193.speaker: Lae'zel
193.text: It is true. Voss - I am no thrall. This was a necessary sacrifice to end the Grand Design.

74.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
74.text: I know what I see - a ghaik master and its servants.

82.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
82.text: Whoever you are, whatever you are, you are overdue a death. Hta'zith!

91.speaker: Player
91.text: I came to face the Netherbrain. If I have to kill you first, so be it.

158.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
158.text: You think you can - wait. I know that voice.

118.speaker: Lae'zel
118.text: I am no thrall, and this is no ghaik. This was a necessary sacrifice to end the Grand Design.

54.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
54.text: Let's say I were to trust you. Let's say I knew that voice.

47.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
47.text: You still slaughtered the true heir, Gith's son and salvation. You sentenced us to slavery!

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Go ahead, kill me - and let the Netherbrain put the Grand Design in motion.

43.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
43.text: Mother Gith, hear me. Yisk Gith'ka tavki krash'ht!
43.context: CinematicNodeContext: Voss goes from hostile stance to normal stanceNodeContext: YISK GITH-kah TAV-ki KRAHSH-het - Mother Gith, reveal your light.

38.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
38.text: The enemy of my enemy is no friend to me. But... I cannot let the ghaik empire swarm the Astral Plane.

144.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
144.text: I will spare you. In fact, I will help you.

88.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
88.text: But when the brain withers, so too does our alliance. It will not just be Vlaakith that hunts you once the embers of battle cool down.

194.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
194.text: Silence. You've made your choice, and I've made mine. Hta'zith!

156.speaker: Player
156.text: Orpheus went mad and attacked me. I had no choice but to kill him.

159.speaker: Narrator
159.text: *Time slows to a crawl while he scrutinises you.*

135.speaker: Narrator
135.text: *In his eyes, his people's past and future, fighting as he tries to understand the true path, the right path. The weight of responsibility, heavy upon him.*

110.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
110.text: I have every reason to kill you. And yet, I believe you.

187.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
187.text: I cannot let the ghaik empire swarm the Astral Plane. And it seems you are my best hope of an ally.

114.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
114.text: When you have need of my aid, call me to battle.

199.speaker: Lae'zel
199.text: Thank you. Orpheus would have asked for no less.

196.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
196.text: May the prince have not fallen in vain. Orpheus gha'g shkath zai.
196.context: NodeContext: Orpheus gawg shkaath ZAI. For the honour of Orpheus.

37.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
37.text: Orpheus would have asked for no less.

14.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
14.text: Now go. I stand at the ready.

17.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
17.text: I know madness. It stands before me, bloated with venom and lies. Hta'zith!

87.speaker: Player
87.text: It couldn't be helped, Voss. But together, we can lead in Orpheus' place.

5.speaker: Player
5.text: Vlaakith lives! May the queen forever reign!

36.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
36.text: You damnable rat - I'll make you pay. Hta'zith!

1.speaker: Player
1.text: You want my head? Just try and take it.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: Cry a prayer to Gith. 'Yisk Gith'ka tavki krash'ht.'

179.speaker: Lae'zel
179.text: Yisk Gith'ka tavki krash'ht. I am no thrall, and this is no ghaik.

90.speaker: Lae'zel
90.text: This was a necessary sacrifice to end the Grand Design.

100.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
100.context: CinematicNodeContext: Waiting in hostile pose. General hostile stance and no weapon is fine.NodeContext: ISS-tark. KRAYTH! (A bit guttural) - angry that player has killed off Prince Orpheus

120.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
120.text: You held the future of a people in your hands. How dare you take our prince from us?
120.context: NodeContext: Angry that player has killed off Prince Orpheus

173.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
173.text: How dare you parade around this abomination?

98.speaker: Lae'zel
98.text: Voss - you know not what you speak of.

81.speaker: Orpheus
81.context: NodeContext: GITH-ka TAHV-kee KRAHSHT! - Gith's light guides us!

136.speaker: Orpheus
136.text: Stand down. The true heir has spoken!

128.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
128.context: NodeContext: Still shocked. Sad and disheartened to see his prince turned to illithid.

138.speaker: Player
138.text: And yet it is. Orpheus took this form so we could defeat the Netherbrain.

52.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
52.text: Orpheus - my prince. What's become of you?
52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Voss goes from hostile stance to normal stanceNodeContext: Sad and disheartened to see his prince turned to illithid.

130.speaker: Player
130.text: That's no way to talk to your prince.

4.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
4.text: Then it's true. Orpheus - my prince. What's become of you?
4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Voss goes from hostile stance to normal stanceNodeContext: Sad and disheartened to see his prince turned to illithid.

183.speaker: Lae'zel
183.text: The Grand Design must be ended. A sacrifice had to be made.

86.speaker: Orpheus
86.text: The Grand Design must be ended. A sacrifice had to be made.

29.speaker: Orpheus
29.text: The duty fell to me. I am not long for this world - or any other.

89.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
89.text: What of Vlaakith? What of our liberty?
89.context: NodeContext: Sad and disheartened to see his prince turned to illithid.

92.speaker: Orpheus
92.text: You underestimate your own people. Their imaginations have kept the name Orpheus alive for millennia.

175.speaker: Orpheus
175.text: Bring them my message, tell them my fate. Some will doubt, some will mock. But some will listen, and the spark will be lit.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: The fight isn't over. Not while my heart still beats.

126.speaker: Orpheus
126.text: Then let it set the rhythm to which our people march.

39.speaker: Orpheus
39.text: Vlaakith's power is finite. The resolve of the githyanki not. For as long as she binds them, there will be those who resist.

151.speaker: Player
151.text: Vlaakith is too powerful. She will destroy the movement before it can spread.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: Githyanki freedom means nothing if the Grand Design comes to pass. We need your help, Voss.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: We're wasting time. We need to face the Netherbrain.

132.speaker: Player
132.text: By the Nine Hells, how did you find us?

77.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
77.text: When the hammer struck, the heir's psionic cry shook the planes and marked his locus. I couldn't have imagined...

22.speaker: Orpheus
22.text: Find your nerve, my friend. Today, we strike at the brain.

119.speaker: Orpheus
119.text: This champion holds the key to the Grand Design's end. Answer to them as you would to me.

15.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
15.context: NodeContext: Sad and disheartened to see his prince turned to illithid.

106.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
106.text: As you wish. I stand at the ready.

172.speaker: Orpheus
172.text: Your friendship, your constancy - when I fell to despair, they elated me. Thank you, my friend. Sha va zai.

58.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
58.context: NodeContext: Shah-vah-zye. 'I love you.' Sad and disheartened to see his prince turned to illithid.

123.speaker: Orpheus
123.text: Now - to the Netherbrain. Let it be the first victim in the War for the Skies.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: Still want to attack? I'm ready when you are.

125.speaker: Orpheus
125.text: Enough. Stand down, both of you.
125.context: CinematicNodeContext: Voss goes from hostile stance to normal stance

48.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
48.text: How dare you parade around this abomination?

7.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
7.text: How dare you deny our freedom?
7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ready to attack - generic 'hostile' pose without a weapon is fine.NodeContext: Angry that player has killed off Prince Orpheus

188.speaker: Lae'zel
188.text: Stand down, Voss. No githyanki will ever be free if the Netherbrain sparks the Grand Design!

76.speaker: Lae'zel
76.text: Stand down, Voss. There will be no Githyanki Empire if the Netherbrain sparks the Grand Design!

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Go ahead, kill me - the only one who can prevent the Grand Design.

155.speaker: Player
155.text: Orpheus went mad and attacked me. I had no choice but to kill him.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: It couldn't be helped, Voss. But together, we can lead in Orpheus' place.

150.speaker: Player
150.text: How could you know that Orpheus died?

117.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
117.text: The heir's psionic cry shook the planes and marked his locus. I will avenge him!

190.speaker: Player
190.text: Vlaakith lives! May the queen forever reign!

133.speaker: Player
133.text: You want my head? Just try and take it.

153.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
153.text: The Prince of the Comet has come!

111.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
111.text: Sha'vah Orpheus! Sha'vah Orpheus! Sha'vah Orpheus!
111.context: CinematicNodeContext: Crying out, hailing his prince, putting his arm up at the beginning of line and dropping it at the end. NodeContext: Sha-va Orpheus! Hail Orpheus!

189.speaker: Orpheus
189.text: Voss, my most loyal friend. How good to set eyes on you.

10.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
10.text: A ghaik keeps you company. Unusual.

62.speaker: Orpheus
62.text: An illithid in guise, an old ally in truth. Lae'zel took this form so I might end the Grand Design.

85.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
85.text: Lae'zel, T'lak'ma Ghir! Can it be?

51.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
51.text: Thanks to you, the skies above Tu'narath shall tremble with psalms!

141.speaker: Narrator
141.text: *Lae'zel remains painfully silent in the face of Voss' fervour. She still seeks Vlaakith's favour.*

192.speaker: Lae'zel
192.text: Mighty Voss, your words lift me. Vlaakith will splinter like glass and vanish like smoke.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: Vlaakith will not give up easily. Is her defeat truly the way forward?

49.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
49.text: The Githyanki Empire is stronger with a free people. What use is a mighty dragon if you've severed its wings?

70.speaker: Player
70.text: Githyanki freedom means nothing if the Grand Design comes to pass. We need your help, Voss.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: Celebrate later. I've got a Netherbrain to face.

50.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
50.text: My sword is yours. We will exterminate the brain and end its plague.

2.speaker: Orpheus
2.text: This champion holds the key to its defeat. Stand by for orders, Voss. Answer to them as you would answer to me.

131.speaker: Orpheus
131.text: Forward - the Netherbrain falls this day. Let it be the first victim in the War for the Skies!

174.speaker: Player
174.text: By the Nine Hells, how did you find us?

32.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
32.text: When the hammer struck, the heir's psionic cry shook the planes and marked his locus. Vlaakith will have heard it too. And she won't stand idle.

68.speaker: Orpheus
68.text: The queen will have her due in time. Today, we strike at the brain.

96.speaker: Orpheus
96.text: An illithid in guise, an old ally in truth. They took this form so I might end the Grand Design.

162.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
162.text: Lae'zel, T'lak'ma Ghir. Thanks to you, the skies above Tu'narath shall tremble with psalms!

109.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
109.text: Orpheus will take the truth to the people. We will slay the lich queen. Our chains will be cleaved.

178.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
178.text: Lae'zel, T'lak'ma Ghir. Thanks to you, the skies above Tu'narath shall tremble with psalms!

59.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
59.text: Orpheus will take the truth to the people. We will slay the lich queen. Our chains will be cleaved.

160.speaker: Narrator
160.text: *Lae'zel remains painfully silent in the face of Voss' fervour. She still seeks Vlaakith's favour.*

104.speaker: Lae'zel
104.text: Mighty Voss, your words lift me. Vlaakith will splinter like glass and vanish like smoke.

42.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
42.text: Thanks to you, my friend, the skies above Tu'narath shall tremble with psalms!

164.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
164.text: Orpheus will take the truth to the people. We will slay the lich queen. Our chains will be cleaved.
